name: Seashell Blizzard Subgroup
description:
This object reflects ATT&CK Technique and other relationships associated with an unnamed "subgroup" of the Russia-linked Seashell Blizzard group, known for a multiyear initial access operation dubbed the "BadPilot" campaign.<sup>[[Microsoft Security Blog February 12 2025](/references/300bf6cb-582b-4e15-8cca-cb68c8856e6f)]</sup>

Seashell Blizzard is a high-impact threat actor linked to the Russian Federation, conducting global activities on behalf of Russian Military Intelligence Unit 74455 (GRU). Its operations range from espionage to information operations and cyber-enabled disruptions, including destructive attacks and manipulation of industrial control systems (ICS). According to Microsoft researchers, Seashell Blizzard "overlaps with" groups tracked as Sandworm Team, APT44, and other names.<sup>[[Microsoft Security Blog February 12 2025](/references/300bf6cb-582b-4e15-8cca-cb68c8856e6f)]</sup>
